content: hey everyone why lock here welcome back
quick 30 second explanation for those of you that may not be familiar with
Warhammer 40k Warhammer 40k is a mass miniatures war game where you set up
your armies and deploy them and then you begin the game proper but not all units
have to be set up at the beginning of the game some units have a special
ability that lets you hold them in reserve and deploy them at a later time
the advantage being you know what's happened and you have more flexibility
in where you can put it on the battlefield but these rules are written
differently for each unit even though they're mechanically identical
for example space marines Terminator squad has teleport strike during
deployment you can set up this unit in a teleport areum chamber instead of
placing them on the battlefield at the end of any air bubble blah put it on the
field compare this for example with the striking scorpions unit from the craft
world elder army they have masters of stealth it says during deployment you
can set up this unit in the shadows instead of placing it on the battlefield
at the end of any of your movement phases the unit can stock from their
hiding place set it up on the battlefield etc mechanically as far as
the game's rules are concerned those are identical they just have this little
flavor sentence at the beginning which i think is really neat and I got to think
in well rather than just have the models sitting off of the game table until
they're deployed later on what if I actually had a teleport areum that I
could have them sitting on right it's just for show there's no no advantage to
the game or anything but why not so let's go build one the idea is that
we'll have these teleportation pads that the models will sit on and it will be a
two tiered room so I found these wooden disks in my junk drawer from a pack of
random wooden bits from the crafting store I set them on corrugated cardboard
and measured out the shape of the room to fit five of them I cut that out
then traced and made a second copy but cut away some of the second copy to give
me just the upper tier I placed the circles in their future home and traced
them just to help me plan things going forward poked holes in the center's this
is what the electronics will be routed through later on and then chipboard I
love this stuff if you're new here this is the grayish brownish slab at the back
of a legal pad but I buy it in bulk on Amazon
this is graphics medium chipboard and there's a link in the video description
below anyway I cut some strips and hot glued
them along the front upper tier then cut some double corrugated strips for the
underside just to provide the understructure something to glue to and
hot glued them on there Christmas light bulb the LED kind not the old-school
kind I remove the bulb to expose the LED itself and then also chopped off as much
of that plastic spike as I could and bent the leads outwards stuck it into
one of the holes and hot glued it in place from the underside then soldered
on lead wires leaving plenty of slack to work with later on with all five
prepared I then hot glued the upper tier to the lower taking care to make sure
they were lined up I based the cardboard with black and then it says cross stitch
mesh you could find it at any crafting store or Walmart that kind of thing it's
like 60 cents for a sheet wherever the sewing materials are but it
is smooth plastic so it needs to be primed
I prefer krylon matte primer and ideally use black so you don't have to come back
and paint it black anyway once it is black over brushed with gunmetal and
then sporadically over brushed with a shimmering silver and copper
I cut shapes to fit the floors and glued them down applying glue along the edges
and also near the LEDs since that section of the grading is going to be
covered up by the pads later on anyway then I clad the sides with chipboard I
decided on a 15 millimeter height below the lower tier so like there's a 15
millimeter tall cavity underneath the whole piece where I can do all the
wiring and I made sure to keep the top of these edges flush with the grating
that's gonna be very important for later on these backsides I used much larger
slabs two of them are sloped so it's sort of like an amphitheater now those
large panels are kind of flimsy so I used cardstock and ripped some long
patches and just hot glued those onto the back to really solidify everything
then I based all that chipboard with black while it was drying I took
leftover empty sprues outside and primed with them and baste them black I also
went through my leftover Space Marines vehicle bits bag for ideas found these
two man holes from a tank kit so I primed those black also then while those
were drying I mounted two more Christmas lights this time I left the bulbs on I
used a standard office hole punch to put holes in each flanking wall and mounted
the light in it using hot glue on the back side soldered up the wires just
like the others for the sprues I just started chopping up segments and hot
gluing them down I made sure to avoid where the four pegs of the teleport pads
are going to be and you could see I kind of wrapped it around the base as well it
continues wherever it goes around a corner
notice those tank bits are around the LEDs and that aquila up there I modeled
it and then 3d printed it and I did the edge trim so this is strips of chipboard
about a quarter inch wide base them in black before attaching them and then
just start hot gluing them along all those edges which very nicely covers up
both the exposed edge of the vertical slabs and the bead of glue under the
grating from earlier at this point there's a lot of freshly cut ends and
some spots that need touch-up so I went back in with black and just touched
everything up to get ready for the next step then I dry brush the main piece
basically everything except the grading got a healthy dry brush of gunmetal
followed by a light selective dry brush with shimmering silver quick and easy
metal look without using a single wash
I would not be a properly obnoxious youtuber if I didn't bring up 25 seconds
of announcements but really if you like this stuff then please like subscribe
reminder Belle want to support the channel totally free use my Amazon
affiliate links in the description below when you buy stuff totally transparent
to you the only difference is that I get a small kick from Amazon for having
referred you our sponsor is heroes hoard and outstanding source of models for you
3d printers out there including but not limited to Altru tiles lines and don't
miss my D&D 5th edition one-shot modules over on the DMS guild candles same as
episode 113 when we made the tavern dressing pieces this is DM Scotty's
toothpick method so coat the toothpick with hot glue except for the last couple
of millimeters of the tip then chop to the desired height and hot glue it to
the piece dribble some hot glue around the base and then down the edge so like
the waxes from melting base coated with beige and then washed with army painter
soft tone just a light brown wash and then painted the tip yellow and then
just the top half of the tip orange can also put a dot of red on top the
teleport pads themselves are based in black then dry brushed with gunmetal and
edge highlighted with shimmering silver i hot glued some ornate beads on the
bottom to function as pedestals create that offset then with a medium brush i
painted some jagged lightning with plain white originating from the center with
the airbrush I chased those lines with white to make them sort of glow then I
chased that with blue I didn't feel the color was saturated enough afterwards so
I then hit it with a glaze of blue wash actually it's not a glaze I just hit it
with the airbrush using blue wash it's army painter blue tone then back to
white drawing a very close very tight beam retracing lightning again
and finally with a fine tip brush bold
white jagged lines in the center of the Lightning to give the final result
electronics I glued together two three
volt watch batteries to create a six volt battery and all seven LEDs are
wired in parallel not series more battery draw that way but easier to
design and gives really nice bright LED performance at this point it's just a
matter of hot gluing the platforms on good dollop of hot glue on the four
pedestals and stick it in place and so it is game night here in the armory I'm
getting ready to film another battle report and I thought I would show you
the teleport atrium in use for the first time so the other guy deployed and over
here you can see I actually have a squad of terminators literally on a teleporter
iam waiting to be beamed down this army by the way was an ebay rescue that I
stripped down and then repainted and these were a speedpaint so they're just
tabletop standard but I'll get some close-ups cuz why not we're here already
you can use the older school non LED Christmas lights but they will draw more
battery using these because we had a whole bunch of LED strings from last
year go bad I don't know if it was a bad batch or what we'll get in for a
close-up on the Lightning effect this I picked up from another youtuber cited
above and I figured you'd want to see what it
looks like in the dark so here you go for the candles I actually had
considered using the orange and yellow or white Christmas lights and coating
them with hot glue so that they would actually glow but I think they'd be too
large for scale no idea what the battery draw is on these seven LEDs they have an
inherent resistance I have no idea what it is so I don't have a resistor in the
circuit but they seem to be working out great I already have several hours of
runtime on this six volt battery that I cobbled together by the way if you want
introduction to custom circuit design and construction see episode 56 oh one
other tip I forgot to mention earlier I painted some shimmering silver on the
underside of the pads just to help with reflection and help that light glow out
from the bottom no idea how helpful it was but overall I am supremely happy
with how this turned out and I want to do more of these mini dioramas for the
reserve scenes from all the different army lists so leave a comment below with
which ones you want me to build if you like this particular project here's two
more you might want to check out also enjoy this community showcase my LOC
thanks for joining and I'll see you next time
